result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Justin I D Jones

records.addlTxt: Plea/sentencing hearing on November 7, 2022 at 10:00 am.

11:39 AM; Case called for Hearing.   Prosecuting attorney Patrick Ryan Campbell in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Justin I D Jones in court.  Attorney Luis Daniel Gutierrez in court for Justin I D Jones. Atty. Gutierrez provides an update; he is requesting a plea and sentencing date in about 45-60 days to allow time for parties to continue to negotiate the matter.  No objection by the State. Court adjourns for projected plea and sentencing.
Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for November 7, 2022 at 10:00 am.
Hearing on September 12, 2022 at 11:00 am.

10:54 AM; Case called for Hearing.  Prosecuting attorney Christian Farina in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Justin I D Jones in court.  Attorney Luis Daniel Gutierrez in court for Justin I D Jones.   Atty. Gutierrez provides an update, he has discovery and an offer but just needs some additional time to review everything with his client.  Atty. Gutierrez requests one final further proceedings in about 30 days.  No objection by the State.  Court adjourns for further proceedings.
Hearing scheduled for September 12, 2022 at 11:00 am.
Effective August 1, 2022, this case is assigned to Branch 7 Judicial Vacancy, pursuant to 22-SO-04(67).

Hearing on August 11, 2022 at 09:30 am.
Hearing on August 16, 2022 at 08:30 am.

11:46 AM; Case called for Hearing.  Defendant Justin I D Jones in court with attorney Luis Daniel Gutierrez.   District Attorney's Office Law Intern Julian Marrufo appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Atty. Gutierrez provides an update, he is asking that 19CT522 be set for trial and this matter can tag along with for status.  Court confirms with counsel 19CT522 would be a 1 day trial.  Court adjourns 19CT522 for jury status and jury trial; this matter will tag along with for status.  Hearing scheduled for August 11, 2022 at 09:30 am.  Hearing scheduled for August 16, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Hearing on June 23, 2022 at 10:30 am.

10:47 AM; Case called for Hearing.  Defendant Justin I Jones in court with attorney Luis Daniel Gutierrez, as a friend of the Court.   District Attorney's Office Law Intern Abigail Kincheloe appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court notes based on the age of this case it will need to be placed on the trial calendar.  Atty. Gutierrez requests 19CT522 be set for plea and sentencing in the next 2 weeks, if possible, and this matter can tag along with for status.  Court adjourns 19CT522 for plea and sentencing and this matter will tag along with for status.  Hearing scheduled for June 23, 2022 at 10:30 am.
